citeinfo.title: Protected Lands Inventory: Nonprofit and Private Lands - November 2004

The Originator, Publisher and Distributor exclude any and all implied warranties and make no warranty or representation with respect to the data files or accompanying documentation, including quality, performance, merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose. idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.0.0.535

attracc.attraccr: Every attempt was made to accurately attribute features in each dataset.

dataqual.logic: As a result of the multiple sources of data used, there are spatial overlaps between features in the some of the layers. Where there was a conflict, a note was included in the ACC_NOTES attribute field in each dataset. Be careful when summarizing areas and acreage and when depicting muliple protected lands layers at the same time.
dataqual.complete: While the Protected Lands Inventory enconpasses the majority of protected lands within the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, there are still significant gaps in the dataset. Only some land trusts and local government provided information on their parks and other protected properties. Some Federal and State acquisitions since 1998 are not reflected. The Nature Conservancy was able to provide data only fee simple acquisitions but not easements. Some environmentally sensitive lands were not included.

horizpa.horizpar: Spatial accuracy varies depending upon the source of the data, although every attempt was made to comply with National Map Accuracy Standards.

citeinfo.title: 1998 PA GAP Analysis Program Managed Lands layer

procstep.procdesc: Data from the 1998 PA GAP Analysis Program was categorized by protection type and separate into multiple categories. The data was then reprojected and reattributed to the PLI standard attribute table.
The Conservation Fund obtained digital data from land trusts and local governments, which was then reprojected and reattributed to the PLI standard attribiute data.
Hard copy data from land trusts was digitized by the Pennsylvania Environmental Council and sent to The Conservation Fund. The Fund then reprojected and reattributed the data.
Data from the three sources were merged into one file for each category: Federal, State, NPF-Private, County-Local, CountyAgEasements.
Spatial conflicts between features were resolved by a GIS analyst at The Conservation Fund. Every attempt was made to include the most accurate spatial features.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Unique ID for each feature using the PLI numbering scheme.
Unique ID usually linked to a PIN or ID# from a land trust or local govenment to facilitate accessing source data.
Calculated acres using a function in ArcMap
Broad classification scheme. Used DIVISION field from GAP data and CONSERVATI from PEC data.
Feature Name. Used UNIT field from GAP layer
Type of protected land. Used LCODE attribute from GAP data.
